SEARCH
Package com.insebre.project.controller

Class AppController

java.lang.Object
com.insebre.project.controller.AppController
public class AppController extends Object
Controller class responsible for managing the application flow and interactions. This class handles the main form and related functionalities. It initializes the main form, loads data, and provides methods for form operations.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ismael Semmar Galvez

  • Constructor Details

    • AppController

      public AppController()

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the application by initializing the main form and loading data. If an exception occurs during initialization, it is handled by the ExceptionController.

    • openMainForm

      public static void openMainForm()
      Opens the main form of the application and initializes its controller. This method sets the table data, loads images, and displays the main form.

    • refreshMainForm

      public static void refreshMainForm()
      Refreshes the main form by updating the table data with the latest programs.

    • refreshSelectedProgramInformation

      public static void refreshSelectedProgramInformation()
      Refreshes the information displayed for the selected program on the main form.

    • validateVersion

      public static boolean validateVersion(String version)
      Validates a software version string. A valid version string consists of three numeric components separated by dots (e.g., "1.0.0").
      Parameters:
      version - The version string to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the version string is invalid, false if it is valid.

    • validateReleaseDate

      public static boolean validateReleaseDate(String releaseDate)
      Validates a release date string. A valid release date string follows the ISO date format (e.g., "yyyy-MM-dd") and is not in the past relative to the current date.
      Parameters:
      releaseDate - The release date string to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the release date string is invalid, false if it is valid.
